intro: Bartsia pedicularoides, commonly known as the clustered bartsia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Bartsia pedicularoides produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer.
